rationale: The species is known from two areas in Myanmar, one in the north, from Indawgyi Lake, and another in the southern delta, with no records in between although it is inferred to occur in areas between the two known records. The species was found to be abundant when collected in the northern area, and at present the species is assessed as Least Concern in the absence of significant threats. The condition of Indawgyi Lake needs to be monitored for potential impacts from a growing human population around its margins.
evaluator: Datta, N.C., Dey, S.C., Jha, B.R. & Allen, D.J.
